Description: Item DescriptionTitle:1984 Gibson USA Explorer 3 Camouflage Electric Guitar Made One Year OnlyDescription:EXPLORER III - offset hourglass Explorer-style alder body; set maple neck; 22-fret rosewood fingerboard with pearl dot inlays; hockey stick Explorer-style headstock with gold Gibson logo decal; six-on-one-side tuners; tune-o-matic bridge with a stop tailpiece or optional locking tremolo bridge; three soapbar P-90 pickups; two knobs (v; tone); two three-way pickup switches; chrome hardware; available in Alpine White; Camouflage; Ebony; or Red finish; 24.75 in. scale; mfg. 1984-85. Gibson Explorer 3 this is a pretty cool old Gibson and these Explorer 3 guitars were only made the one year as far as I know. This 1984 Explorer 3 for sure is ebony wood for the fretboard and not rosewood as the Blue Book Info is incorrect at least to this specific Explorer 3. The Gibson Branded Kahler Tremolo probably was an original factory option but I do not know this for sure and this guitar comes with two different tremolo bars. These Explorer 3 guitars had 3 of the P-90 Soapbar single coil pickups and one volume and one tone knob; and two pickup selector switches and the tuners are an upgrade to Grover Tuners. This vintage 84 Explorer 3 is in very good condition it does present as a used guitar and shows some normal signs of past usage over 30+ years; including one small screw is missing from the electronics cavity plastic plate on the backside. There is some slight but noticeable dings/dents and or nicks and chips to the camo finish of this guitar; one dent is pictured by the input jack; also there is a small paint chip on tip of the headstock; as well as some few pictured scratches and scrapes most noticeable on the topside of the guitar. Also there is some crazing/checking or finish age cracks to the camo paint finish of the guitar; and these are just surface finish cracks and do not affect play ability at all. This Explorer 3 plays and sounds very nice the set neck is straight and the string action is low; and the ebony board and 22 frets are in great shape 95% + usable life left in the frets. Before I bought the guitar the previous owner had it professionally set up with neck relief adjusted; and intonation set and the electronics were serviced including the vol/tone pots were deoxidized and cleaned. This vintage 1984 somewhat rare and HTF Gibson Explorer 3 will ship in its HSC which is also in very good condition. Size: Not provided. Condition: See above. Title: 1984 Gibson USA Explorer 3 Camouflage Electric Guitar Made One Year Only
